title: Grateful Dead

description:
Browse: this just in · this day in history · average review rating · number reviews · date reviewed · number views

Created in 2004 this collection consists of both audience and soundboard recordings. It is not uncommon to find multiple versions of the same show. For more information please see the FAQ. The Grateful Dead collection is not currently open to public uploads.

Search Shows:
Downloadable Shows - usually audience recordings
Stream-only Shows - usually soundboard recordings
Today in History - shows on this month and day

Here you can browse:

Downloadable Shows (typically, Audience recordings), and
Stream-Only Shows (typically, Soundboard recordings).
Shows on this Day in History

Discussion Resources

The Grateful Dead Forum is focused discussion area for the Grateful Dead.
In contrast, the Live Music Archive forum is a more general venue for discussion about thousands of other LMA bands, and for more general technical questions about the LMA collection.
See the FAQ, and the collection's policy notes below for more information. Limited Flag: LimSpecial / LimProject / LimShows / LimSBDs / LimRange. At this time, the Grateful Dead collection is not open to public uploads. The Grateful Dead Internet Archive Project (GDIAP) will continue its direct management of this collection for the time being.

Grateful Dead Guide
Deadlists

title: grateful dead

description:
June 10, 1973 - Audience fob Dead played the night show - ending 8 hours after it began - this was a Modal Spectacle Grateful Dead and Allman Brothers Band RFK Stadium - Washington, DC Sunday show - Jer with pigtails

visit the Saturday show

FOB — stereo mic hand-held on mic stand shaft - w/ my arm raised high — TAPED in stereo

Set 1 Morning Dew Beat It On Down The Line Ramble On Rose Jack Straw Wave That Flag Looks Like Rain Box Of Rain They Love Each Other The Race Is On Row Jimmy El Paso Bird Song Playing In The BandSet 2 Eyes Of The World -> Stella Blue Big River Here Comes Sunshine Around And Around Dark Star -> He's Gone -> Wharf Rat -> Truckin' Sugar MagnoliaSet 3 jam with Merl Saunders, Dickey Betts, Butch Trucks It Takes A Lot To Laugh It Takes A Train To Cry That's All Right, Mama The Promised Land Not Fade Away -> Goin' Down The Road Feeling Bad -> Drums -> Not Fade Away Johnny B. Goode
Archive bit torrent — June 10 transfers by Matt Smith at 24/96
Archive bit torrent — June 10 transfers by Matt Smith at 16/44

Dave Usborne's Matrix for this show on The Archive
bonus audio tracks for Dead-Heads
• Billy for President rap • banter track remastered by Monte
bonus video tracks for Dead-Heads
• Hippie Temptation documentary - 1967 • Mountains of The Moon - Playboy after Dark • Next Time You See Me - 1972 • 8mm silent film clip of GD on 73-06-10 filmed by Bud Styple
bonus photo collection for Dead-Heads
• 937 JPG images spanning all the GD years • zipped up into one 260 MB archive ZIP file • in the Whole Item section with ZIP files

description:
June 9, 1973 - Audience fob Dead played the day show - it was sunny & hot - temperature was over 100° F Grateful Dead and Allman Brothers Band RFK Stadium - Washington, DC Saturday show - dudes climbing on stage

visit the Sunday show

FOB — stereo mic hand-held on mic stand shaft - w/ my arm raised high — TAPED in stereo

Set 1 Promised Land Deal Looks Like Rain They Love Each Other Jack Straw Loose Lucy Mexicali Blues Row Jimmy El Paso Box of Rain Sugaree Beat It On Down the Line Tennessee Jed Greatest Story Ever Told China Cat Sunflower -> I Know You RiderSet 2 He's Gone -> Truckin' -> Playin' in the Band Loser Me and My Uncle Mississippi Half Step Big River Eyes of the World -> China Doll Sugar Magnolia
